modules.description: This module defines configuration options for establishing SSL connections in an IRC client. It includes a boolean flag to enable certificate validation and specifies the SSL protocol version to use. The default configuration provides safe, commonly used settings for these parameters.

This module handles secure network communication for IRC clients using Lwt and SSL. It provides functions to establish SSL-encrypted connections, read and write data over sockets, and manage connection states. It works with `inet_addr` for addressing and `config` for connection settings, making it suitable for implementing robust, asynchronous IRC clients with encryption.

This module implements secure, asynchronous IRC client functionality with Lwt and SSL. It provides connection management, message sending (JOIN, PRIVMSG, etc.), and event handling for IRC protocols. Key operations include connecting to servers, sending IRC commands, and listening for messages with automatic reconnection support.
